abstract: Responding to readers' comments on my column and the question of whether the Tea Party will transform itself from the Party of Against into a force that can make things happen.
snippet: Responding to readers' comments on my column and the question of whether the Tea Party will transform itself from the Party of Against into a force that can make things happen.
lead_paragraph: The comment stream in response to my Monday column - "Is the Tea Party Over?" - was divided for the most part into one camp of readers proclaiming the inevitable triumph of the Tea Party, and another, larger camp praying for its demise. There's no point quarreling with faith (in the first case) or hope (in the second). To my mind the question is whether the Tea Party will transform itself from a backlash - the Party of Against - into a force that can make things happen. The movement's best hope of making that leap any time soon, which you can view with approval or alarm, is Rick Perry.
